summary: This is a JPMorgan Chase bank statement for the business checking account of AIR GHISLAINE INC, covering June 2007. It shows a large deposit of $7.55 million and subsequent debits, including a $7.35 million payment to Sikorsky Aircraft Corp for the purchase of a helicopter. The document is marked as a government exhibit.

persons.name: Francisco Villacis
persons.context: Listed as a contact on the JPMorgan Private Bank team for the account holder AIR GHISLAINE INC.

events.title: Helicopter Purchase Payment
events.description: AIR GHISLAINE INC made a payment of $7,352,825.00 to Sikorsky Aircraft Corp for the purchase of a Sikorsky S76C helicopter and a downpayment on executive finish.

events.title: Large Funds Transfer into Account
events.description: A total of $7,550,000.00 was deposited into the AIR GHISLAINE INC business checking account via transfers and credits during June 2007.

locations: New York Strategy Group LLC (associated account name)
Stratford, CT 06614 (location of Sikorsky Aircraft Corp)
Fort Worth, TX 76101 (location of Bell Helicopter Textron)
keyFacts: AIR GHISLAINE INC, an entity associated with Ghislaine Maxwell, held a business checking account at JPMorgan Chase with significant financial activity in June 2007.
The account received a total of $7.55 million in deposits/credits and disbursed $7.38 million in debits during the statement period, leaving an ending balance of ~$201,000.
A single transaction of $7,352,825 was paid to Sikorsky Aircraft Corp for the 'PURCHASE OF A GREEN HELICOPTER SIKORSKY S76C AND DOWNPAYMENT ON EXECUTIVE FINISH'.
The document is labeled 'GOVERNMENT EXHIBIT 501' and 'Confidential Treatment Requested by JPMorgan Chase', indicating its use in legal proceedings.
A smaller credit of $50,000 from Bell Helicopter Textron, described as a 'DEPOSIT REFUND', is also recorded.
